text: The ninth season of The Voice began airing on 24 May 2020. For the first time in the show's history all of the coaches returned: Delta Goodrem for her eighth, Kelly Rowland and Boy George for their fourth and Guy Sebastian for his second. Following the exit of Sonia Kruger, Darren McMullen, who hosted the first four seasons, returns with new co-host, Renee Bargh. Chris Sebastian from Team Kelly won the competition on 19 July 2020, marking the second All- Star to win, as well as Kelly Rowland's second victory as a coach. ==Coaches and hosts== Right after the end of the eighth season, the series was renewed for a ninth season and was announced that all coaches would return the new season. Darren McMullen, who exited as host following the conclusion of the fourth season, returns as host, alongside new co-host Renee Bargh, following the exit of Sonia Kruger. In June 2020 the Sydney Morning Herald reported that Marcia Hines and The Veronicas were to fill in as guest mentors for Rowland and Boy George respectively, who will be mentoring their acts remotely from the US and UK because of travel restrictions in place due to the COVID-19 pandemic. ==Teams== Colour key {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; width:100%;" |+ Season nine coaching teams ! Elyse Sene-Lefao and Jimi the Kween were chosen to replace them, respectively. ==Blind auditions== In the Blind Auditions, each coach had to complete their teams with 12 contestants. Producers allowed him to keep Wolf as the 13th member of his team with the condition of losing two artists in a three-way battle in the next round. ==Battle rounds== The Battle rounds started on 21 June. The coaches can save two losing artists from any team, including their own. Contestants who win their battle or are saved will advance to the Playoffs. {| class="toccolours" style="font-size: 90%; white-space: nowrap;" |+ Season nine battle rounds colour key | style="background:#fdfc8f; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist won the Battle and advanced to the Playoffs |- | style="background:#b0e0e6; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist lost the Battle but was saved by their coach or another coach, and advanced to the Playoffs |- | style="background:#00fa9a; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist lost the Battle and was originally eliminated, however, received the Coach Comeback, advancing to the Playoffs |- | style="background:pink; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist lost the Battle and was eliminated |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width:100%;" |+ Season nine battle rounds |- ! 6 | style="background:#FDFC8F;"| Adam Ludewig | "Wrecking Ball" | style="background:#00fa9a;"| Elyse Sene-Lefao | |- |} *Delta could not decide on a winner between Janie and Matt. With approval from the producers, she suggested they become a duo, and both artists agreed. The duo adopted the stage name "Goldi". ==Playoffs== The Playoffs started on 5 July. In the Playoffs, each coach pairs two of their artists together, with each artist singing an individual song following a theme. After all of their team's playoffs were done, the coaches chose one of their losing artists as a wildcard. The top 20 contestants who win their Playoff or are chosen as a Wildcard move on to the Showdowns. Due to COVID-19 and travel restrictions, Kelly and George mentored their artists remotely, with Marcia Hines and The Veronicas filling in as guest mentors respectively. Artists Caleb Jago-Ward from Team George and Ella Monnery from Team Kelly were unable to continue on the competition also due to travel restrictions, being stuck in New Zealand. Coaches George and Kelly were allowed to bring back an eliminated Battle loser to fill in for Caleb and Ella, George choosing Elyse Sene-Lefao and Kelly chose Jimi the Kween. {| class="toccolours" style="font-size: 90%; white- space: nowrap;" |+ Season nine playoffs colour key |- | style="background:#fdfc8f; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist won the Playoff and advanced to the Showdowns |- | style="background:#b0e0e6; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist lost the Playoff but was chosen as a wildcard and advanced to the Showdowns |- | style="background:pink; border:1px solid black;"| | Artist lost the Playoff and was eliminated |- |} ===Episode 15 (5 July)=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width: 91%;" |+ Episode 15 playoffs |- ! To even out her team, Kelly was granted an extra wildcard pick. ===Episode 17 (7 July)=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width: 91%;" |+ Episode 17 playoffs |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:5%;"| Order ! rowspan="2" style="width:10%;"| Coach ! rowspan="2" style="width:15%;"| Theme ! colspan="2" style="width:35%;"| Winner ! colspan="2" style="width:35%;"| Loser |- ! style="width:17%;"| Artist ! style="width:18%;"| Song ! style="width:17%;"| Artist ! style="width:18%;"| Song |- ! 1 | Delta | Australia | bgcolor="#fdfc8f"| Steve Clisby | “I Still Call Australia Home” | style="background:pink" | Emmagen Rain | style="background:pink" | "Not Pretty Enough” |- ! 2 | George | Sia | bgcolor="#fdfc8f"| Virginia Lillye | "Chandelier” | style="background:pink" | Sapphire Tamalemai | style="background:pink" | “Breathe Me” |- ! 3 | Guy | '90s | bgcolor="#fdfc8f"| Stephanie Cole | “Show Me Love” | style="background:pink" | Soma Sutton | style="background:pink" | "The Boy Is Mine” |- ! 4 | Kelly | Bruno Mars | bgcolor="#fdfc8f"| Chris Sebastian | “24K Magic” | bgcolor="#b0e0e6"| Lyric McFarland | bgcolor="#b0e0e6"| "Grenade” |} *Guest mentors The Veronicas performed their latest single "Biting My Tongue". == Grand finale week == ===Showdowns=== The Showdowns were first broadcast on 12 and 13 July 2020. Over the two episodes, all artists of the Top 20 take on a solo performance of a song of their choice. Teams Kelly and Guy performing on the first night, with Teams Delta and George performing on the second night. At the end of each episode, the coaches choose two out of their five artists to advance to the Semifinals. {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center; width:80%;" |+ Episodes 18 showdown |- ! width="1%"| Order ! scope="col"| Performer(s) ! scope="col"| Song |- ! scope="row"| 18.1 | Delta Goodrem and the Top 20 | "Keep Climbing" |- ! scope="row"| 19.1 | Amy Shark | "Everybody Rise" |} ===Semi-finals=== The Semi-finals episode was first broadcast on 14 July 2020. At the end of the episode, the coaches were allowed to take one artist each through to the Grand Finale, which was an exclusive feature of this season due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This also marks Guy Sebastian's first season with an artist in the Grand Finale. {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; width:80%;" |+ Episodes 20 Semi-final |- ! width="1%"| Order ! width="10%"| Coach ! width="17%"| Contestant ! width="27%"| Song ! width="15%"| Result |- ! scope="row"| 1 | bgcolor="pink"| George | bgcolor="pink"| Masha Mnjoyan | bgcolor="pink"| "Rain on Me" | bgcolor="pink"| Eliminated |- ! scope="row"| 2 | bgcolor="pink"| Delta | bgcolor="pink"| Jesse Teinaki | bgcolor="pink"| "Cellophane" | bgcolor="pink"| Eliminated |- ! scope="row"| 3 | bgcolor="pink"| Kelly | bgcolor="pink"| Mark Furze | bgcolor="pink"| "Youngblood" | bgcolor="pink"| Eliminated |- ! scope="row"| 4 | George | Siala Robson | "Where Is The Love?" | bgcolor="#B0E0E6"| Saved by coach |- ! scope="row"| 5 | bgcolor="pink"| Guy | bgcolor="pink"| Timothy Bowen | bgcolor="pink"| "Reason To Live" (Original) | bgcolor="pink"| Eliminated |- ! scope="row"| 6 | Kelly | Chris Sebastian | "Before You Go" |bgcolor="#B0E0E6"| Saved by coach |- ! scope="row"| 7 | Delta | Stellar Perry | "Believe" |bgcolor="#B0E0E6"| Saved by coach |- ! scope="row"| 8 | Guy | Johnny Manuel | "A Change Is Gonna Come" |bgcolor="#B0E0E6"| Saved by coach |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |+ Non-competition performances |- ! scope="col"| Order ! scope="col"| Performer ! scope="col"|Song |- ! scope="row"| 20.1 | Daryl Braithwaite | "Love Songs" |- ! scope="row"| 20.2 | Guy Sebastian | "Standing with You" |} ===Grand Finale=== The Grand Finale was first broadcast on 19 July 2020. Each artist performed a solo song and a duet with their coach, or a guest singer. This was the only episode of the season where the results were determined by public vote and not by the coaches. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; width:89%;" |+ Solo performances |- ! width="1%" | Order ! width="10%" | Coach ! width="15%" | Contestant ! width="17%" | Song ! width="15%" | Result |- style="background:gold;" ! scope="row"| 2 | Kelly | Chris Sebastian |"Numb" by Linkin Park |Winner |- style="background:silver;" ! scope="row"| 5 | George |Siala Robson |"God Is a Woman" by Ariana Grande |Runner-up |-style="background:silver;" ! scope="row"| 6 | Guy |Johnny Manuel | "My Heart Will Go On" by Céline Dion |Runner-up |-style="background:silver;" ! scope="row"| 8 | Delta |Stellar Perry |"Anyone" by Demi Lovato | Runner-up |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; width:89%;" |+ Duet performances |- ! rowspan="2" width="5%" |Order ! colspan="2"| Duet performers ! rowspan="2" width="30%" | Song |- ! width="10%" |Coach ! width="10%" |Contestant |- ! scope="row"| 1 | George | Siala Robinson | "Untouched" by The Veronicas (with The Veronicas) |- ! scope="row"| 3 | Delta | Stellar Perry |"Running Up That Hill" by Kate Bush |- ! scope="row"| 4 | Guy | Johnny Manuel | "Black and Gold" by Sam Sparro |- ! scope="row"| 7 | Kelly | Chris Sebastian | "Horses" by Daryl Braithwaite (with Daryl Braithwaite) |} *Due to COVID-19 travel restrictions, Boy George and Kelly could not perform with their artists, so Boy George had The Veronicas sing with Siala, while Kelly had Daryl Braithwaite sing with Chris. ==Grand finale week results== ===Overall=== ====Artist's info==== ====Result details==== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:100%; width:auto;" |+ Live Shows results per week |- ! style="width:11%;" colspan="2" rowspan="2"| Artist !
